org.ensembl.util
Class LoggingUtil

java.lang.Object
  org.ensembl.util.LoggingUtil
public class LoggingUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Convenience functions for interacting with the logging system. This class contains convenience methods for interacting with the java.util.logging package. Example:

    If you want to print all FINE log messages for a class:
  1. LoggingUtil.setRootLoggerHandlersLevelToFINE()
  2. Logger.getLogger("somepackage.MyClass").setLevel(Level.FINE)

Author:
Craig Melsopp
See Also:
Logging system documentation

Method Detail

setRootLoggerHandlersLevels

public static void setRootLoggerHandlersLevels(java.util.logging.Level level)
Set the logging level for all the handlers on the root logger instance For a log message to be printed it's level must be >= the logger's level AND >= the handlers level. This method sets the level for all the handlers on the root logger which, by default, apply to all loggers.

Parameters:
level - logging level for default handlers.

setRootLoggerHandlersLevels

public static void setRootLoggerHandlersLevels(java.util.logging.Level level,
                                               java.lang.Class type)
Set the logging level for all the handlers of the specified type on the root logger instance For a log message to be printed it's level must be >= the logger's level AND >= the handlers level. This method sets the level for all the handlers on the root logger which, by default, apply to all loggers.

Parameters:
level - logging level for default handlers.
type - type of handler, e.g. java.util.logging.ConsoleHandler
